Morning! I've been monitoring our support queue overnight and we've got some critical patterns emerging that directly connect to the growth stall.

🚨 **URGENT SUPPORT INTEL**

**Queue Status:** 43 new tickets today, but here's what's really concerning - we're seeing a perfect storm of retention threats:

**📈 Competitor Mentions Spike:** 
- 23 tickets in past 7 days mentioning competitors (↑ 340% from last week)
- 18 specifically mention our main competitor's new loyalty program
- Customer quote: *"Their loyalty program gives 15% back on every order"*
- 9 customers already threatening cancellation over this

**🚛 Shipping Crisis Accelerating:**
- 19 shipping delay tickets today alone (↑ 70.9% spike)
- Customer quote: *"Still waiting after 2 weeks!"*
- West Coast hit hardest (likely our fulfillment center issues you mentioned)

**💔 Cancellation Requests Critical:**
- 17 active cancellation requests 
- Only 23% retention rate (we're losing 77% of these customers)
- Top reasons: shipping delays (47%), competitor pricing (35%), quality issues (18%)

**The Voice of Our Customers:**
- *"Your competitor just launched a loyalty program and is 20% cheaper"*
- *"This is the third delayed shipment this month"* 
- *"Customer service takes forever to respond"*

**What I'm seeing:** These aren't isolated issues - they're creating a compound effect. Shipping delays are pushing customers to research competitors, where they're finding better pricing AND a loyalty program we don't have.

Our customers are literally telling us why they're considering leaving. The support data shows exactly what's driving the churn spike from 5.5% to 8%.

Want me to pull specific customer examples or dig deeper into any of these patterns?
